member.name: N:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.ManagedConnections
member.summary: The namespace contains connections that are managed connections, contained directly in a connection manager. If is used on these classes, their value is returned. Other connection managers are native, and . returns System.__ComObject. For all connection types, it is recommended that you set properties using .

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.ManagedConnections.MSMQConn
member.summary: Contains the methods and properties used by Message Queuing (MSMQ) connections. It has been defined with the DtsConnection attribute, .

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.ManagedConnections.MSMQConn.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.ManagedConnections.MSMQConn.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, and initializes the path to the message queue.
member.param: The path to the message queue.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.ManagedConnections.MSMQConn.AcquireConnection(System.Object)
member.summary: Establishes the Message Queuing (MSMQ) connection and returns a connection object.
member.returns: The connection object containing the Message Queuing connection.
member.param: The handle to a transaction type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.ManagedConnections.MSMQConn.LoadFromXML(System.Xml.XmlElement,Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.IDTSInfoEvents)
member.summary: This method is not callable by your application code. To load a package that is saved as .xml to the hard drive, use the method.
member.param: The node that contains the information to be loaded.
An object that implements the interface for raising events (errors, warnings, and so on) during persistence.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.ManagedConnections.MSMQConn.SaveToXML(System.Xml.XmlDocument,Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.IDTSInfoEvents)
member.summary: This method is not callable by your application code. To save a package as .xml, use the method.
member.param: The XML document to save the information to.
An object that implements the interface for raising events (errors, warnings, and so on) during persistence.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.ManagedConnections.MSMQConn.ConnectionDescription
member.summary: Returns the localized description of the connection.
member.returns: A String that contains the localized description of the connection.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.ManagedConnections.MSMQConn.ConnectionDisplayName
member.summary: Returns the localized display name of the connection.
member.returns: A String that contains the localized display name of the connection.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.ManagedConnections.MSMQConn.ConnectionString
member.summary: Gets or sets the connection string for the Message Queuing (MSMQ) connection.
member.returns: A String that contains the connection string for the Message Queuing connection.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.ManagedConnections.MSMQConn.Path
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to the files.
member.returns: A String that contains the path to the files.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.ManagedConnections.SMOServerConn
member.summary: Contains the methods and properties used by SMO connections.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.ManagedConnections.SMOServerConn.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, initializing the authentication mode, user name, and password.
member.param: A Boolean that specifies whether the connection manager uses Windows Authentication. true if Windows Authentication is used.
The user name that the connection manager uses.
The password that the connection manager uses.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.ManagedConnections.SMOServerConn.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, initializing the authentication mode, user name, password, and server.
member.param: A Boolean that specifies whether the connection manager uses Windows Authentication. true if Windows Authentication is used.
The user name that the connection manager uses.
The password that the connection manager uses.
The name of the server to which you want to make the SMO connection.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.ManagedConnections.SMOServerConn.ConnectionDescription
member.summary: Gets the description of the connection manager for the SMO connection.
member.returns: A String that describes the connection manager for the SMO connection.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.ManagedConnections.SMOServerConn.ConnectionDisplayName
member.summary: Returns the localized display name of the connection.
member.returns: A String that contains the localized display name of the connection.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.ManagedConnections.SMOServerConn.ConnectionString
member.summary: Gets or sets the connection string for the SMO connection.
member.returns: A String that contains the connection string for the SMO connection.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.ManagedConnections.SMOServerConn.Password
member.summary: Sets the password for the connection, if you do not use Windows Authentication.
member.returns: A String that specifies a password for the connection.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.ManagedConnections.SMOServerConn.SqlServerName
member.summary: Gets or sets a String that contains the name of the SQL Server to which you want to make the SMO connection.
member.returns: A String that contains the name of the SQL Server to connect to as an SMO connection.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.ManagedConnections.SMOServerConn.UserName
member.summary: Gets or sets the user name for the connection, if you do not use Windows Authentication.
member.returns: A String that contains the user name for the connection.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.ManagedConnections.SMOServerConn.UseWindowsAuthentication
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean that indicates if Windows Authentication is used for the connection.
member.returns: true if Windows Authentication is used in the connection; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.ManagedConnections.SMTPConn.EnableSsl
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean indicating whether to encrypt communication using Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) when sending e-mail messages.
member.returns: true indicates that communication is encrypted, using Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) when sending e-mail messages. false indicates that encryption is not used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.ManagedConnections.SMTPConn.SmtpServer
member.summary: Gets or sets the name used to connect to the SMTP server.
member.returns: A String that contains the name used to connect to the SMTP server.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.ManagedConnections.SMTPConn.UseWindowsAuthentication
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean indicating whether to access the SMTP server using Windows Authentication.
member.returns: true indicates that Windows Authentication is used to authenticate access to the server. false indicates that Windows Authentication is not used.
